verses.roman:
bhrātreyo bhagavān kṛṣṇaḥ
śaraṇyo bhakta-vatsalaḥ
paitṛ-ṣvasreyān smarati
rāmaś cāmburuhekṣaṇaḥ

synonyms: bhrātreyaḥ—brother's son; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; kṛṣṇaḥ—Kṛṣṇa; śaraṇyaḥ—the giver of shelter; bhakta—to His devotees; vatsalaḥ—compassionate; paitṛ-svasreyān—the sons of His father's sister; smarati—remembers; rāmaḥ—Lord Balarāma; ca—and; amburuha—like lotus petals; īkṣaṇaḥ—whose eyes.
translation: Does my nephew Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality and the compassionate shelter of His devotees, still remember His aunt's sons? And does lotus-eyed Rāma remember them also?
